2018-06-10T20:02:42Z: So, that's about that for our live coverage, but remember to keep checking the site for plenty of post-race reaction tonight and more news through the week.Here's our report – join us in a couple of weeks for the start of F1's first triple-header. Bye bye! Canadian Grand Prix: Vettel takes F1 championship lead with winSebastian Vettel took a dominant victory in the Canadian Grand Prix, grabbing the lead of the Formula 1 world championship on a tough day for Lewis Hamilton
2018-06-10T19:59:44Z: Vettel celebrates with his Ferrari mechanics. He leaves Montreal leading the championship.
2018-06-10T19:58:57Z: Time for the trophies, and the champagne. Celebration all-round for this trio: Ferrari and Vettel the happiest of the lot.
2018-06-10T19:56:50Z: And now the much more buoyant Italian anthem for Ferrari, which definitely gets stuck in the head of at least two of our F1 journalists.
2018-06-10T19:55:54Z: Time for the national anthems, Germany first for the victorious Vettel.
2018-06-10T19:55:32Z: Everyone is gathered by the podium. Here come the drivers, including a bounding Vettel!
2018-06-10T19:52:27Z: Bottas says he got into a bit of trouble running out of fuel, which allowed Verstappen to close in.
2018-06-10T19:51:54Z: Vettel's final word is to call this a day to remember Gilles Villeneuve. Nice touch.
2018-06-10T19:49:49Z: Vettel's picked up a Ferrari flag and, helmet still on, is walking around waving it. He's delighted, but finally being guided back to his post-race media obligations.
2018-06-10T19:48:46Z: Vettel hops (literally) out of the holding area for the cars to dive into his Ferrari team's arms. Meanwhile, Mercedes congratulates Bottas on a job well done.
2018-06-10T19:48:15Z: Vettel also becomes the first driver this season to reach three victories. Arms aloft – he's a happy chappy. Bottas and Verstappen will not be unhappy to be second and third and, pretty comprehensively, ahead of their team-mates.
2018-06-10T19:47:33Z: Vettel makes it back to the pitlane. His 50th grand prix victory earned with supreme control.
2018-06-10T19:46:26Z: Vettel is lapping up the applause. Huge Ferrari support down at the hairpin, and Vettel is enjoying this. He's on the back straight now.
2018-06-10T19:45:28Z: Outside the points: 11 Gasly; 12 Grosjean; 13 Perez; 14 Magnussen; 15 Ericsson; 16 Vandoorne; 17 Sirotkin
2018-06-10T19:45:03Z: Ricciardo ended the race with the fastest lap on the final tour: 1m13.835s.
2018-06-10T19:44:59Z: Result: 1 Vettel; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Ricciardo; 5 Hamilton; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Hulkenberg; 8 Sainz; 9 Ocon; 10 Leclerc
2018-06-10T19:44:29Z: Bottas fends off Verstappen for second, and Ricciardo keeps Hamilton at bay with ease in the end to finish fourth.
2018-06-10T19:44:06Z: NOW the chequered flag comes out for real. Vettel wins the Canadian Grand Prix and takes the championship lead!
2018-06-10T19:43:39Z: Vettel points out to Ferrari that he's not done yet...
2018-06-10T19:43:20Z: Err...the chequered flag is out. But there's a lap left.
2018-06-10T19:43:04Z: Vettel is onto the final lap. Serene drive for the Ferrari man.
2018-06-10T19:42:51Z: Bottas does the same in the middle sector to fend off Verstappen!
2018-06-10T19:42:41Z: Ricciardo pumps in the best first sector of the race so far as he bids to repel Hamilton's attack.
2018-06-10T19:41:46Z: In the reverse of the Mercedes/Red Bull fight a little way up the road, Verstappen is within DRS range of Bottas for the first time. Two laps left!
2018-06-10T19:41:26Z: Further frustration for Hamilton who catches Sirotkin through the fast sweeping Turn 5. Bit more time lost. Hamilton has it all to do.
2018-06-10T19:40:41Z: Hamilton's right behind Ricciardo but he's made a mistake at the hairpin and that's probably ruined a great chance to attack down the back straight. Ricciardo survives another lap. Three laps left.
2018-06-10T19:40:31Z: Just 3.8s now covers Gasly, Grosjean, Magnussen and Perez in 11th to 14th. But chances of wild excitement seem slender today.
2018-06-10T19:39:06Z: Mercedes tells Hamilton he can go all out to fight Ricciardo. He's back on the tail of the Red Bull, which is yet to clear Hulkenberg.
2018-06-10T19:38:29Z: Sudden fastest lap of the race from Verstappen, a 1m13.864s. He's 1.8s behind Bottas – a late fight for second?
2018-06-10T19:37:37Z: McLaren tells Vandoorne he'll have a shot at passing Ericsson soon as they both get lapped and as the Sauber's tyres fade. The gap is now 3.7s in their sort-of-battle for 15th.
2018-06-10T19:37:13Z: Five laps to go and Vettel leads by eight seconds. The only fight at the front is Ricciardo vs Hamilton for fourth.
2018-06-10T19:36:51Z: Hamilton loses a bit of time behind Ocon. Ricciardo got a nice little gap from that. Next up for the Red Bull to clear: both Renaults.
2018-06-10T19:35:48Z: Plenty of traffic ahead of Ricciardo. This fight could get tasty.
2018-06-10T19:35:40Z: Grosjean is heavily hassling Gasly for 11th. Go on Grosjean, give us some late thrills.
2018-06-10T19:33:27Z: Hamilton's told he can turn the engine down to save fifth, given Raikkonen's so far back – but he says no, and insists he can fight. Mercedes says go for it.
2018-06-10T19:32:11Z: Order with 10 laps to go: 1 Vettel; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Ricciardo; 5 Hamilton; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Hulkenberg; 8 Sainz; 9 Ocon; 10 Leclerc; 11 Gasly; 12 Grosjean; 13 Magnussen; 14 Perez; 15 Ericsson; 16 Vandoorne; 17 Sirotkin
2018-06-10T19:32:10Z: Ricciardo responded to Hamilton's latest bout of pressure with a personal best but the gap is still only just over a second. That fight's not completely settled.
2018-06-10T19:31:27Z: Vettel's lead out to 7.8s now, Verstappen 4.6s behind Bottas. It's all over bar the shouting.
2018-06-10T19:31:11Z: Having pitted very late, Grosjean has fresher tyres than almost everyone. He's using them to catch Gasly for 11th.
2018-06-10T19:30:48Z: Perez's chase of Magnussen for 13th has tailed off, he's now 2s behind.
2018-06-10T19:30:18Z: Toro Rosso's urging of Gasly doesn't look like it'll bring a point - Leclerc has opened the gap between them in 10th and 11th to 5.4s.
2018-06-10T19:29:43Z: Vandoorne has made a second pitstop to take on some new hypersofts. That dropped him from 15th to 16th and he's now catching Ericsson again.
2018-06-10T19:28:59Z: Being lapped by the leaders has brought the Renault/Force India battle a bit closer. Sainz, who lost a bit of ground skipping the final chicane a while ago, is under a second behind seventh-placed Hulkenberg with Ocon 3s back.
2018-06-10T19:28:14Z: Vettel's having some fun: new fastest lap at 1m13.964s. Race over?
2018-06-10T19:28:00Z: Hartley has been taken to hospital for a scan after his massive first-lap crash with Stroll. Both got out of their cars unaided and were then checked in the medical centre, with Hartley now being sent on for further checks.
2018-06-10T19:27:25Z: Vettel's lapped everybody outside the big three teams. Two-tier F1 at its...finest?
2018-06-10T19:27:09Z: Bottas lost 2.3s to Vettel with that error. He's 5.5s behind now, and 4.3s clear of Verstappen. Will the Mercedes crack on for those last 13 laps?
2018-06-10T19:26:22Z: Argh, nightmare for Bottas! He'd got to 3s behind Vettel but has had an off at Turn 1 lapping Hulkenberg. Not too dramatic but lost time taking to the grass and fathering it all back up. That's cost him a couple of seconds.
2018-06-10T19:25:51Z: Perez is now pushing Magnussen hard for 13th with 15 laps to go.
2018-06-10T19:24:48Z: Are we going to get a proper lead fight? Bottas gets the gap down to 3.3s now...
2018-06-10T19:23:29Z: Gasly is now 3.4s behind Leclerc in the fight for 10th, having lost ground in the last little spell. Their pace is pretty similar.
2018-06-10T19:22:16Z: Speaking of attacks – Botta trims more time out of Vettel's lead, which is down to 4.3s.
2018-06-10T19:21:59Z: Hamilton within DRS range of Ricciardo. Is there an attack coming for fourth?
2018-06-10T19:21:01Z: Another good lap from Bottas: a new flying lap in fact. A 1m13.992s gets him 4.6s behind Vettel.
2018-06-10T19:20:38Z: That extra pitstop might pay off for Perez looking at the rate at which he's now catching Magnussen fro 13th on fresh supersofts. But he's got two Haases to pass that he didn't have ahead of him before.
2018-06-10T19:20:01Z: There's a really weird ebb and flow at the front. Vettel's kind of stable, but Verstappen took a few tenths out of Bottas over two laps: then Bottas hits back with a personal best to lap half a second quicker than both. Currently, this race is just occasional bursts of pace to rebuild chunky gaps. Not exactly thrilling.
2018-06-10T19:18:29Z: Grosjean finally pits on lap 49 of 70. His pit approach included a bit of grass in a near-miss with Ocon!
2018-06-10T19:17:51Z: McLaren says Alonso's retirement was due to an exhaust problem.
2018-06-10T19:17:31Z: Verstappen's pace is nice at the moment. He's marginally quicker than the two ahead of him and well clear of Ricciardo, who has Hamilton hovering just outside DRS range.
2018-06-10T19:15:56Z: Vettel's steadied the time loss so that does appear to have been traffic induced. The gap is 5.3s.
2018-06-10T19:13:34Z: Perez comes off the back of Gasly to make a second pitstop. He only loses one place, to Magnussen and rejoins 14th.
2018-06-10T19:13:28Z: Vettel's pace is a bit poor at the moment. Traffic to blame? Bottas has trimmed the gap down to 4.9s now and Vettel was slower than Verstappen, Ricciardo and Hamilton in recent laps too.
2018-06-10T19:11:34Z: Big lock-up from Hamilton into the hairpin. Raikkonen's some 3s behind him now though, so not exactly vulnerable.
2018-06-10T19:10:45Z: With Vandoorne a distant 15th after his early puncture, McLaren looks set for another zero-points race on a day when main constructors' rival Renault has both cars in the top eight.
2018-06-10T19:10:07Z: Alonso was running 11th but was certain to move into 10th when Grosjean finally pits. He'd overcome Leclerc and was on course to salvage a point.
2018-06-10T19:09:57Z: Vettel pushes his lead out to 6.4s now. Verstappen half a dozen seconds behind Bottas. Not a great one, this...YET.
2018-06-10T19:08:58Z: Alonso is slowing, looks like he's out.
2018-06-10T19:06:59Z: Vettel kills Bottas's momentum with two swift laps, the second of which is a new fastest lap: 1m14.163s.
2018-06-10T19:06:53Z: Leclerc is getting a bit of a breather now, with Gasly off his tail and working harder on keeping Perez behind him for 13th.
2018-06-10T19:05:51Z: The frontrunners are disappointingly spaced apart, although the gaps get smaller as you move down the top six: Vettel, Bottas +5.6s, Verstappen +5.7s, Ricciardo +4.3s, Hamilton +2.1s, Raikkonen +1.1s.
2018-06-10T19:04:55Z: Grosjean might now have a shot at getting ahead of team-mate Magnussen through this long first stint strategy, which would put him on course for 15th from the back of the grid. Could be worse.
2018-06-10T19:04:45Z: Bottas starts this pursuit in decent fashion: a new fastest lap, 1m14.512s. The gap is 5.4s.
2018-06-10T19:03:59Z: Order: 1 Vettel; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Ricciardo; 5 Hamilton; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Hulkenberg; 8 Sainz; 9 Grosjean; 10 Ocon; 11 Alonso; 12 Leclerc; 13 Gasly; 14 Perez; 15 Magnussen; 16 Vandoorne; 17 Ericsson; 18 Sirotkin
2018-06-10T19:03:39Z: So the leaders made it to just after mid-distance before getting rid of those ultrasofts. It's a comfortable one-stop – and Bottas is 5.8s behind the Ferrari. Any chance of a race lies in the hands of the Finn.
2018-06-10T19:02:34Z: Ferrari is responding immediately and Vettel pits.
2018-06-10T19:02:25Z: Bottas stops. Nice and clean, not hugely rapid but quick enough. He rejoins with no traffic, fresh supersofts – and a chance to put some pressure on Vettel. But he was half a dozen seconds behind so there's not much undercut potential.
2018-06-10T19:01:55Z: Not a brilliant day for Hamilton so far, who is in fifth -  can it all change in the second half of the race?
2018-06-10T19:01:24Z: Speaking of Mercedes, the pit crew is getting ready – and Bottas is told to pit.
2018-06-10T19:01:08Z: Raikkonen's got stuck within DRS range of Hamilton and doesn't look all that racy behind the Mercedes.
2018-06-10T19:00:54Z: Having finished letting Vettel through, Leclerc, Gasly and Perez can now resume their fight for 13th with just 2.2s covering the trio as we pass half-distance.
2018-06-10T19:00:05Z: Although Ocon probably now feels like he's spent a billion laps stuck behind the yet-to-stop Grosjean, the Haas's pace is OK and he's still only 3s behind Sainz in eighth, and 5s off Hulkenberg in seventh.
2018-06-10T18:59:54Z: Raikkonen sets a new fastest lap (1m15.026s) on his first flying lap on these supersofts and is now right on Hamilton's tail.
2018-06-10T18:59:25Z: The other key question (probably more important given it involves the leaders not the battle for fifth) is how long will Vettel and Bottas go?Bottas was a second slower than Vettel on the last couple of laps, and is now 6s behind Vettel.
2018-06-10T18:58:57Z: The Leclerc/Gasly/Perez battle for 12th (11th when Grosjean pits) is being lapped by Vettel right now, which is temporarily spreading it out.
2018-06-10T18:58:10Z: The key question now is will Raikkonen's fresh tyres offer enough to attack Hamilton, if not now then later on?
2018-06-10T18:57:54Z: Ooooooh! So close! Hamilton catches traffic through Turns 1 and 2 in the form of Sirotkin's Williams, which almost lets Raikkonen jump the Mercedes. But he can't do it, and Hamilton just about sneaks ahead of the Williams to stay in front of Raikkonen.
2018-06-10T18:57:13Z: Best of the rest order on lap 33: 7 Hulkenberg; 8 Sainz; 9 Grosjean (yet to stop); 10 Ocon; 11 Alonso; 12 Leclerc; 13 Gasly; 14 Perez; 15 Magnussen; 16 Vandoorne; 17 Ericsson; 18 Sirotkin
2018-06-10T18:56:53Z: Raikkonen pits – has he done enough to jump Hamilton?
2018-06-10T18:56:42Z: Vettel getting a bit of traffic – catches Perez's Force India at the chicane and has to wait until Turn 1 before getting past. His lead is over 4s though.
2018-06-10T18:55:42Z: The gap between Raikkonen and Hamilton is 18 seconds. So the Mercedes should jump the Ferrari, but it'll be quite close.
2018-06-10T18:55:19Z: Having lost out to Alonso in the pitstops, Leclerc hasn't fallen away from the 11th-placed McLaren and is still under two seconds behind. But he's got to look in his mirrors as he has Gasly and the recovering Perez pushing him.
2018-06-10T18:54:39Z: Vettel's lead is up to 3.8s now. Verstappen's been edging closer to Raikkonen but the long-running Ferrari isn't really his target.
2018-06-10T18:53:27Z: Ocon is putting a lot of pressure on Grosjean for ninth but the Haas remains impossible to shift for now.
2018-06-10T18:52:59Z: Vettel responds to the small amount of pressure being applied by Bottas, and sets the fastest lap: 1m15.059s.
2018-06-10T18:52:03Z: Doesn't look like running long is going to work any miracles for Grosjean. He's likely to emerge from his pitstop behind team-mate Magnussen in 15th.
2018-06-10T18:51:17Z: Ricciardo is urged to stay close enough to Verstappen to get a tow, which he is told will help defend from Hamilton. Currently, the Mercedes is not that close to getting within DRS range: 1.8s behind.
2018-06-10T18:50:32Z: Sirotkin pits from 16th. He'll drop behind Vandoorne and Ericsson who were right behind him on the track and rejoin 18th and last.
2018-06-10T18:50:18Z: Looks like the drivers who stopped for supersofts are now the quickest: the used ultrasofts are giving up some time. Vettel has shipped another 0.4s to Bottas, who is 3.4s behind now.
2018-06-10T18:49:32Z: A suggestion that Hamilton's problem in the first stint was a cooling issue that Mercedes is managing a little better since the pitstop.
2018-06-10T18:49:26Z: Vandoorne has passed fellow first-lap stopper Ericsson for 17th and is now trying to get around the yet-to-pit Sirotkin for 16th.
2018-06-10T18:48:41Z: Sainz passes the yet-to-pit Grosjean for eighth with an easy DRS move.
2018-06-10T18:48:16Z: Perez is now attacking Gasly for 13th, and has brought Magnussen with him.
2018-06-10T18:47:59Z: Slow lap from Vettel and a big lock-up into the hairpin is to blame. Bottas takes a big chunk out of the gap: 1.5s. Just 3.7s between them now.
2018-06-10T18:47:36Z: Hulkenberg returns to seventh place, with a straightforward move on Grosjean - who will presumably pit soon. In the meantime, Grosjean's being attacked by Sainz.
2018-06-10T18:47:18Z: Bottas flying on this lap and has just taken a second out of Vettel in the middle sector...
2018-06-10T18:46:39Z: Gasly rejoins 13th, ahead of Perez and Magnussen, behind Alonso and Leclerc.
2018-06-10T18:46:03Z: Alonso spending the first part of his 300th F1 race fending off Leclerc
2018-06-10T18:46:02Z: The yet-to-pit Grosjean in eighth now has both Renaults right behind him. They all get elevated a place as Gasly pits from seventh.
2018-06-10T18:45:29Z: Magnussen is the first of the Haas duo to pit, and he rejoins just behind Perez but ahead of Sirotkin in 15th.
2018-06-10T18:45:03Z: Not the first time we've said this lately, but what a sad race for Williams again. Stroll out in a massive first-lap shunt and Sirotkin 16th out of 18 but with two cars on his tail who've already pitted.
2018-06-10T18:44:12Z: Perez passes Sirotkin for 15th and will now try to chase the Alonso/Leclerc battle for what is currently 13th.
2018-06-10T18:44:01Z: Hamilton's coming back at Ricciardo and is within DRS range of the Mercedes. Role-reversal of the pre-pitstop fight: you'd fancy the Merc over the Red Bull with DRS.
2018-06-10T18:43:47Z: Alonso and Leclerc coming in means Gasly is now seventh, with the Haases behind him.
2018-06-10T18:42:02Z: Looks like Alonso managed to get ahead of Leclerc as the Sauber came out of the pits. That is effectively for 10th.
2018-06-10T18:41:34Z: The Red Bulls and Hamilton are now lapping quicker than Raikkonen in third, so Hamilton's unlikely to drop behind the second Ferrari now.
2018-06-10T18:40:30Z: Vettel's not coming under pressure from Bottas, but the gap has remained constant at 4.6s. Raikkonen's quite a way back, 16.3s behind his race-leading team-mate.
2018-06-10T18:40:19Z: Alonso comes off Leclerc's tail and pits. He gets out in 14th, just ahead of the Sirotkin, Ericsson, Perez, Vandoorne battle. What will Leclerc do now his rival has stopped for supersofts?
2018-06-10T18:38:48Z: Ricciardo emerges well clear of Hamilton in the end. It goes from bad to worse for Mercedes' reigning world champion. Raikkonen's cracking on at a pace that might well jump Hamilton too.
2018-06-10T18:38:26Z: Leclerc had half a cheeky look at attacking Hamilton when the Mercedes emerged from the pits. It didn't work and Alonso is now back on Leclerc.
2018-06-10T18:38:17Z: Supersofts for the Red Bull. Can Ricciardo get out ahead......he can! And he's right behind team-mate Verstappen, too.
2018-06-10T18:37:52Z: He is: Ricciardo stops. Will he jump Hamilton? Hamilton's had Leclerc all over him on this outlap.
2018-06-10T18:37:37Z: Ricciardo lighting up the timing screens now he's free of Hamilton – first two sectors are the best of the race so far. Is he about to pit and jump the Mercedes?
2018-06-10T18:37:05Z: Both cars taken on supersofts, and are back on their way. Hamilton just stays out ahead of Leclerc's Sauber.
2018-06-10T18:36:32Z: And just like that, Verstappen pits – and Hamilton follows him in.
2018-06-10T18:36:14Z: Verstappen's pace isn't stunning at the moment, lapping a second slower than the lead two and a couple of tenths slower than Ricciardo who is a little stuck behind Hamilton. The lead Red Bull might stop before too long.
2018-06-10T18:36:00Z: The Renault and Force India pitstops mean Leclerc and Alonso's battle - which has calmed down a bit - is temporarily for seventh place, with Gasly, Magnussen and Grosjean next up.
2018-06-10T18:35:40Z: Ricciardo's within DRS range. He'll have three opportunities to activate that and get a straightline speed boost – but will it be enough to overhaul the Mercedes, even one that could be limping?
2018-06-10T18:35:28Z: Perez remains last. He's been stuck behind a Sirotkin, Ericsson and Vandoorne train since he made that early pitstop.
2018-06-10T18:35:07Z: Very neat from Renault - Sainz slots in between Hulkenberg and Ocon so the Force India has been jumped by both.
2018-06-10T18:34:33Z: Bottas matches Vettel's time at the front for the first time, which means after 14 laps the Ferrari is 4.5s clear. Verstappen's 4s further back, with Hamilton 2.2s behind the lead Red Bull. Is that Mercedes still wounded? Ricciardo's almost within DRS range and will strike if so...
2018-06-10T18:34:14Z: Renault brings Sainz in on the next lap.
2018-06-10T18:33:20Z: Hulkenberg takes supersofts and rejoins ahead of Ocon, leaping him for a potential seventh.
2018-06-10T18:33:01Z: Hulkenberg comes in. Ocon has passed Sirotkin and is back up to 14th.
2018-06-10T18:31:23Z: The stewards say they'll take no action over the Perez/Sainz bump.
2018-06-10T18:31:03Z: Verstappen's fallen further away from Bottas but isn't exactly under pressure from Hamilton. Actually, Hamilton is 1.6s behind Verstappen – and he has the second Red Bull of Ricciardo slightly closer behind.
2018-06-10T18:31:02Z: Ocon does Hulkenberg a favour by pitting. He swaps to supersofts and rejoins 15th, just ahead of lap one pitters Ericsson and Vandoorne.
2018-06-10T18:29:07Z: Fastest lap for Vettel at the front, 1m15.475s – that's almost a second quicker than Bottas! Mighty effort to push his lead out to 3.6s.
2018-06-10T18:29:05Z: Perez being down in 18th is because he's just pitted and dumped his hypersofts for supersofts.
2018-06-10T18:28:40Z: Lap 10 order: 1 Vettel; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Ricciardo; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Ocon; 8 Hulkenberg; 9 Sainz; 10 Leclerc; 11 Alonso; 12 Gasly; 13 Magnussen; 14 Grosjean; 15 Sirotkin; 16 Ericsson; 17 Vandoorne; 18 Perez
2018-06-10T18:28:27Z: Hamilton's still running just outside DRS range of Verstappen, so whatever problem Hamilton has it is not too troublesome at this stage.
2018-06-10T18:27:52Z: Vettel's nicely in control at this stage, 2.6s clear with nine laps complete. Bottas has edged clear of Verstappen, who is out of DRS range now.
2018-06-10T18:27:41Z: Both Renaults are now tucked up behind Ocon in seventh, with Hulkenberg telling the team he's certain he's faster than the Force India.
2018-06-10T18:27:15Z: The scene of the incident between Perez and Sainz, from Edd Straw who is trackside. Perez is down in 14th
2018-06-10T18:27:08Z: Alonso emerged from that busy restart in 11th and is now all over Leclerc for 10th, but the rookie is holding the double champion off beautifully whatever Alonso tries.
2018-06-10T18:26:33Z: Perez pulled off a heck of a save after that incident, slewing across the Turn 1/2 grass sideways and nearly backwards at high speed but rejoining without wiping anyone out. He's now down to 14th.
2018-06-10T18:25:46Z: Hamilton currently running just over a second behind Verstappen in third. Vettel's lead is out to 2.2s now.
2018-06-10T18:24:11Z: Vettel's lead sticks at 1.5s but Verstappen is pressuring Bottas, staying within DRS range of the Mercedes. Ricciardo's also within DRS range of Hamilton. Red Bull looking decent on the hypersofts.
2018-06-10T18:22:24Z: Handsome 1.5s lead for Vettel already after that restart. It's as you were behind.
2018-06-10T18:22:05Z: Sainz and Perez make contact, with Perez sliding off the road and dropping to 13th.
2018-06-10T18:21:30Z: Vettel gets us back under way, and it's a great restart from the Ferrari. Bottas has Verstappen for close company.
2018-06-10T18:20:49Z: Replays show Ricciardo did the opposite of Verstappen – he was on the outside of Raikkonen through Turn 1, which put him inside for Turn 2. That gave him the chance to jump the Ferrari.
2018-06-10T18:19:05Z: Order: 1 Vettel; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Ricciardo; 6 Raikkonen; 7 Ocon; 8 Hulkenberg; 9 Sainz; 10 Perez; 11 Leclerc; 12 Magnussen; 13 Sirotkin; 14 Alonso; 15 Gasly; 16 Grosjean; 17 Ericsson; 18 Vandoorne
2018-06-10T18:18:36Z: Obviously everyone gets a chance to tick off some laps without pushing the tyres hard but not bad for Verstappen and Ricciardo, running third and fifth, to be able to extend this opening stint on hypersofts out a bit more. Plus, with everyone on cold rubber, will they be able to attack more at the restart?
2018-06-10T18:16:26Z: Ericsson and Vandoorne have pitted under the safety car for this crash and both gone onto supersofts. Vandoorne really struggled to get away.
2018-06-10T18:15:41Z: Both Stroll and Hartley are out of their cars unscathed. Hartley's Toro Rosso rode right up on the barriers on its side for a few scary seconds.
2018-06-10T18:15:40Z: At the front, behind the safety car, Vettel leads from Bottas, Verstappen, Hamilton, Ricciardo and Raikkonen – so the second Red Bull has got ahead of the second Ferrari.
2018-06-10T18:15:07Z: Hartley hit the wall very hard on the approach to Turn 5 as he drew alongside Stroll. The Williams got sideways and squeezed the Toro Rosso into the barriers horribly.
2018-06-10T18:14:15Z: Ocon got past Hulkenberg into seventh place behind the top three teams.
2018-06-10T18:13:56Z: Big crash for Brendon Hartley and Lance Stroll at the tail of the field.
2018-06-10T18:13:50Z: Verstappen draws alongside Bottas but the Mercedes driver toughs it around the outside and holds the place into Turn 2.
2018-06-10T18:13:26Z: The Canadian GP is go! Vettel holds the lead into Turn 1 as Verstappen attacks Bottas into the first corner.
2018-06-10T18:12:57Z: Here we go, Grosjean completes the grid. Waiting for the lights...
2018-06-10T18:12:31Z: Backmarkers just making their way to the final chicane now...
2018-06-10T18:12:08Z: Vettel's already onto the start-finish straight. He'll be waiting a little while at this rate! Eager beaver (or should that be groundhog, eh?)
2018-06-10T18:10:11Z: Engines fired up: Vettel leads the field away for the formation lap.
2018-06-10T18:08:59Z: Interesting that Sirotkin, at Williams, has gone for something unique: he's the only driver starting on supersofts. Outside of the top 10 only the Toro Rossos are starting on hypers.
2018-06-10T18:08:13Z: Remember: we have differing tyre strategies at the front. The Ferrari and Mercedes drivers have ultrasofts, the rest in the top 10 have hypersofts. Can Verstappen make use of that extra grip at the start to get the jump?
2018-06-10T18:06:03Z: Five minutes to the start of the race. Can you feel the tension?
2018-06-10T18:03:50Z: If you need a nice, simple reminder – here's the top 10 on the grid: Vettel; Bottas; Verstappen; Hamilton; Raikkonen; Ricciardo; Hulkenberg; Ocon; Sainz; Perez.
2018-06-10T18:00:31Z: Sky Sports F1 reporting that the intercooler on Raikkonen's Ferrari has been changed – supposedly the same problem that struck the engine in Grosjean's Haas yesterday. Ferrari checked all Ferrari-engined cars after Grosjean's spectacular qualifying failure.
2018-06-10T17:57:42Z: National anthem time. Well-observed – no controversy like in Spain! Although playing the Catalan anthem would be particularly odd here.
2018-06-10T17:53:43Z: How. Cool. Is. This. Photo: LAT
2018-06-10T17:49:54Z: Why is Gasly facing a tough race from the back? Here's why: Canadian GP: Gasly to start on back row with new Honda F1 engineToro Rosso's Pierre Gasly will start the Canadian Grand Prix from the back row of the grid after taking a new Honda Formula 1 engine
2018-06-10T17:47:42Z: Need a reminder of what happened yesterday and how the grid has formed? Look no further: Canadian Grand Prix: Sebastian Vettel puts Ferrari on poleFerrari's Sebastian Vettel claimed pole position for the Canadian Grand Prix, with his Formula 1 title rival Lewis Hamilton only fourth
2018-06-10T17:46:03Z: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Canadian Grand Prix. Qualifying was fascinating and we've got three different teams in the first three positions – so this should be fun, right?
